message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.SOC, cs.CYBER, cs.CL 

This paper uses Twitter data and Monte Carlo simulations to study political polarization and social division, which are topics that fall under the categories of social media analysis (cs.SI), social network analysis (cs.SD), computational social science (cs.SOC), cybersecurity (cs.CYBER), and natural language processing (cs.CL) due to the analysis of fake news. However, since the paper focuses more on the social and political aspects of the problem rather than the technical aspects, we rank cs.SI and cs.SD as the most likely categories.
